data.question: What was the source of the chemicals used in the synthesis?
data.answer: Solvents and reagents were purchased from TCI Co., Ltd., WAKO Pure Chemical Industries Ltd., and Sigma-Aldrich Co.

data.question: What type of glassware was used for the research?
data.answer: Micro vials were used for the research.

data.question: What equipment was used for HPLC separation?
data.answer: A JASCO UV-970 spectrometer equipped with a JASCO PU-980 pump and an ODS column DEVELOSIL ODS-5, Nomura Chemical Co., LTD.

data.question: How was the guest inclusion into crystalline sponges performed?
data.answer: Guest inclusion was performed by soaking tiny crystals of porous complexes in a solution of the target, allowing the complexes to absorb the target molecules.

data.question: What was the method used for X-ray structural analysis?
data.answer: The structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares calculations on F2 using the SHELX 97 program.

data.question: What was the plant material used in the study?
data.answer: C. Unshiu was the plant material used in the study.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis conditions involved the use of an incubator to maintain temperature during guest inclusion.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of using the PLATON SQUEEZE program in the study?
data.answer: The PLATON SQUEEZE program was used to treat residual electron densities in the solvent-accessible void due to disordered solvent molecules.

data.question: True or False: Elemental analysis was performed on a CHN/O/S elemental analyzer CE-440, Exeter Analytical, Inc.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the method used for the inclusion of cyclohexanone into a crystal of 2?
data.answer: A crystal of 2 was soaked in a drop of cyclohexanone at room temperature, and after standing for 2 days, it was mounted onto the X-ray diffractometer.

data.question: True or False: Microscopic IR spectra were recorded on a Varian DIGILAB Scimitar instrument.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the crystallographic data for the inclusion complex 3•6?
data.answer: Crystallographic data: C36H24N12Zn3I6•0.6(C5H8), Mr =1623.05, crystal dimensions 0.08 × 0.05 × 0.05 mm3, Monoclinic, space group, C2/c.

data.question: True or False: The research involved the use of a Bruker APEX-II CCD diffractometer for single crystal X-ray diffraction data collection.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the guest molecule used in the nano-to-micro gram scale guest inclusion?
data.answer: Guaiazulene (7) was the guest molecule used in the nano-to-micro gram scale guest inclusion.

data.question: True or False: The study involved a simplified blind test for analyzing compounds using the general procedure shown in the main text.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the result of the blind test for guest B5?
data.answer: Guest B5 was initially solved as a disordered model.

data.question: True or False: The inclusion complex 3•8 involved a chiral guest.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the method used for LC-SCD analysis of PMFs?
data.answer: The mixture of PMFs was dissolved in THF, separated by analytical HPLC, and each fraction was collected and incubated with a crystal of 3 and cyclohexane for 1 week at 45 ºC.

data.question: True or False: The structural analysis of Miyakosyne A involved the inclusion of the compound into a crystal of 3.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the challenge faced in the complete stereochemistry determination of Miyakosyne A?
data.answer: The challenge was the determination of the absolute configuration at C14 of Miyakosyne A, as conventional methods were not effective.
